contextId.occurrenceNote: The narrator uses exaggeration to emphasize the great amount of silver that was in Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "The king had so much silver in Jerusalem, it was like there was as much silver as there was stones on the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: The king made silver and gold as common in Jerusalem as the stones

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may refer either 1) to the people whom Solomon called to Jerusalem and who are listed in 5:2 or 2) generally to those who traveled to Jerusalem for the feast, not necessarily to every male person who lived in Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All the men of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "all" is a generalization meaning very many Israelites. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the assembly of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration that emphasizes the great number of animals that were sacrificed. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "sacrificing more sheep and oxen than anyone could count" or "sacrificing very many sheep and oxen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: sacrificing sheep and oxen that could not be counted

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "all the assembly" is a generalization. It does not mean that every person of Israel was standing, but that all of the people who were gathered there were standing. Alternate translation: "while the people of Israel there were standing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: while all the assembly of Israel was standing

contextId.occurrenceNote: This generalization refers either 1) to the people whom Solomon called to Jerusalem and who are listed in [2 Chronicles 5:2](../05/02.md), or 2) to those who traveled to Jerusalem for the feast, not necessarily to every person who lived in Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This generalization refers to those who were at the feast in Jerusalem, not necessarily to every person who lived in Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This generalization refers to those who were at the feast in Jerusalem, not necessarily to every person who lived in Israel. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all Israel with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. Alternate translation: "everything she wanted to know" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all that was in her heart

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "all" here is a generalization. Alternate translation: "Kings from around the world" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All the kings of the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration to emphasize that there was such a great amount of silver. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: as much as the stones on the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "all" is a generalization. Alternate translation: "from many other places" or "from many other countries" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: from all the lands

contextId.occurrenceNote: This exaggeration means that there were more soldiers than a person could easily count. Alternate translation: "Many soldiers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: Soldiers without number

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "all" is a generalization. The phrase means that David assembled people from all over Judah and Benjamin. Alternate translation: "He gathered together people from all over Judah and Benjamin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: He gathered all Judah and Benjamin

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "all" is a generalization. The phrase means that people from all over Judah rejoiced. Alternate translation: "People all over Judah rejoiced" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All Judah rejoiced

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization that refers to all the people who are present. Alternate translation: "All the other people who are present" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization to refer to all the people of Judah who were present in the courtyard that day. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization to show that many people participated in the event. Alternate translation: "A very large number of the people of the land" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All the people of the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization that means a large group of the people did this. Alternate translation: "a very large group of the people went to the temple of Baal" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the people went to the house of Baal

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization that means he took very many people with him. Alternate translation: "a very large group of the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the people of the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is generalization to say that most of the people rejoiced. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: So all the people of the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. Some people probably did not respond this way. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All the leaders and all the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration to emphasize the thoroughness of the slaughter. Alternate translation: "so that they were all completely destroyed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: so that they were all broken in pieces

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization that refers to the soldiers of Judah who survived the battle. Alternate translation: "the surviving soldiers of Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: every man

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "All" is a generalization. Some people may not have wanted him to be king. Alternate translation: "The people of Judah took the 16 year-old Uzziah and made him king after his father, Amaziah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: All the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. Alternate translation: "in the same way" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: in everything

contextId.occurrenceNote: God wanted his people to offer sacrifices to him in Jerusalem. The word "every" here is an exaggeration to show how determined King Ahaz was to disobey God by offering sacrifices in many other places instead. Alternate translation: "under many green trees" or "under many green trees around the country" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: under every green tree

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a generalization. Alternate translation: "many other people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is an exaggeration, as there were kingdoms over which Cyrus did not rule. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-hyperbole]])
contextId.glQuote: all the kingdoms of the earth
